learning.supervised.evaluation.cv

Class MultiCrossValidation

  • java.lang.Object
    • learning.supervised.evaluation.cv.MultiCrossValidation

  • public class MultiCrossValidation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the functionality necessary to conduct a cross-validation procedure for evaluating a set of classifiers on a dataset.

        Initialization.
        Parameters:
        times - Integer that is the number of times to repeat the fold split and evaluation process.
        folds - Integer that is the number of folds to generate in each repetition.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.

        folds - Integer that is the number of folds to generate in each repetition.
        numClasses - Integer that is the number of classes in the data.
        totalDistMat - float[][] that is the upper triangular distance matrix on the training data.

    • Method Detail

      • setExternalContext

        public void setExternalContext(ExternalExperimentalContext contextObjects)
        Parameters:
        contextObjects - ExternalExperimentalContext object potentially holding pre-calculated re-usable kNN sets and/or the distance matrix.

      • setTrainTestIndexes

        public void setTrainTestIndexes(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>[][][] trainTestIndexes)
        This method sets the train/test indexes explicitly and is used for OpenML compatibility. It should not be used otherwise, but standard split/fold configurations should be provided, as that is a more fine-grained control of what goes on in cross-validation. This explicit train/test specification might be more flexible, but also allows some less favorable configurations if no checks are performed.
        Parameters:
        trainTestIndexes - ArrayList[][][] representing the train and test index lists for all repetitions and folds.

      • getTrainTestIndexes

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>[][][] getTrainTestIndexes()
        This method gives the used train and test indexes, if the folds have been tracked or the train/test configuration was set externally.
        Returns:
        ArrayList[][][] that are the train / test indexes.

      • setAllFolds

        public void setAllFolds(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>[][] allFolds)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the pre-computed folds to the cross-validation procedure. An exception is thrown if the dimensions of the array of lists of indexes do not correspond to the number of times and folds that have been set in this cross-validation context.
        Parameters:
        allFolds - ArrayList[][] representing all folds in all repetitions of the cross-validation procedure, by giving indexes of the points within the dataset in each split.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the fold array dimensionality does not correspond to the times x numFolds that are set within this cross-validation context.

      • getAllFolds

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>[][] getAllFolds()
        Returns:
        ArrayList[][] representing all folds in all repetitions of the cross-validation procedure, by giving indexes of the points within the dataset in each split.

      • useMultipleCommonThreads

        public void useMultipleCommonThreads(int numCommonThreads)
        This sets the number of threads to use for distance matrix and kNN set calculations.
        Parameters:
        numCommonThreads - Integer that is the number of threads to use for distance matrix and kNN set calculations.

      • setProtoHubnessMode

        public void setProtoHubnessMode(int protoHubnessMode)
        Parameters:
        protoHubnessMode - Integer code that indicates which prototype hubness estimation mode to use, whether to use the biased simple approach or to estimate the prototype occurrence frequencies on the rejected points as well.

      • setDataReducer

        public void setDataReducer(InstanceSelector dreducer,
                  float selectionRate)
        Sets the instance selection structures.
        Parameters:
        dreducer - InstanceSelector that is to be used for data reduction.
        selectionRate - Float that is the instance selection rate.

      • getDataReducer

        public InstanceSelector getDataReducer()
        Returns:
        InstanceSelector that is being used for data reduction.

      • getPerPointClassificationPrecision

        public float[][] getPerPointClassificationPrecision()
        Returns:
        float[][] representing the point classification precision for each tested algorithm.

      • getAllFuzzyLabelAssignments

        public float[][][][] getAllFuzzyLabelAssignments()
        Returns:
        int[][][][] representing all fuzzy label assignments given per algorithm for all repetitions of the CV framework.

      • useSecondaryDistances

        public void useSecondaryDistances(BatchClassifierTester.SecondaryDistance secondaryDistanceType,
                         int secondaryK)
        Parameters:
        secondaryDistanceType - SecondaryDistance that is to be used.
        secondaryK - Integer that is the neighborhood size to use when calculating the secondary distances.

      • setCombinedMetric

        public void setCombinedMetric(CombinedMetric cmet)
        Parameters:
        cmet - CombinedMetric object for distance calculations.

      • setKValue

        public void setKValue(int k)
        Parameters:
        k - Integer that is the neighborhood size to test for.

      • setAutoKRange

        public void setAutoKRange(int kMin,
                 int kMax)
        In case the algorithms are expected to automatically determine the optimal k-value.
        Parameters:
        kMin - Integer that is the lower range value for the neighborhood size.
        kMax - Integer that is the upper range value for the neighborhood size.

      • setApproximateKNNParams

        public void setApproximateKNNParams(boolean approximate,
                           float alpha)
        Parameters:
        approximate - Boolean flag indicating whether to use the approximate kNN sets.
        alpha - Float that is the quality parameter for the Lanczos bisection approximate kNN method.

      • validateOnSeparateLabelArray

        public void validateOnSeparateLabelArray(int[] testLabels)
        Parameters:
        testLabels - int[] representing the labels of the training points to evaluate the classification performance against.

      • obtainFoldTestNeighbors

        public int[][] obtainFoldTestNeighbors(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> trainFoldIndexes,
                              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> testFoldIndexes,
                              DataSet trainDSet,
                              float[][] pointDistances,
                              int k)
        This method obtains the kNN sets of test points containing the training neighbor points.
        Parameters:
        trainFoldIndexes - ArrayList representing the training data indexes.
        testFoldIndexes - ArrayList representing the test data indexes.
        trainDSet - DataSet that is the training data context.
        pointDistances - float[][] representing the distances between test and training points.
        k - Integer that is the current neighborhood size.
        Returns:
        int[][] that are the desired kNN sets.

      • performAllTests

        public void performAllTests()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        This method runs the experimental protocol for multi-threaded cross-validation and compares multiple algorithms on a single dataset.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testAndEvaluateClassifier

        public void testAndEvaluateClassifier(int algIndex,
                             int repetitionIndex,
                             int foldIndex,
                             float[][] foldDistMatrix,
                             float[][] testToTrainingDistances,
                             int[][] testToTrainingNeighbors)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        This method does all the classifier testing and evaluation.
        Parameters:
        algIndex - Integer that is the index of the classifier to evaluate.
        repetitionIndex - Integer that is the index of the current repetition in the CV framework.
        foldIndex - Integer that is the fold index in the current CV framework.
        foldDistMatrix - float[][] representing the upper triangular distance matrix on the training data.
        testToTrainingDistances - float[][] representing the distances between the test and the training points.
        testToTrainingNeighbors - int[][] representing the neighbors of the test points among the training points.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getEstimators

        public ClassificationEstimator[][] getEstimators()
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator[][] representing an array of arrays of classification estimators for each algorithm and round in the cross-validation framework.

      • getAverageResults

        public ClassificationEstimator[] getAverageResults()
        Returns:
        ClassificationEstimator[] representing the average classification results for each algorithm.

      • setKeepAll

        public void setKeepAll(boolean keepAll)
        Parameters:
        keepAll - Boolean flag indicating whether to keep track of all classifier evaluations or just the average ones after all the runs. The default is true.

      • getKeepAll

        public boolean getKeepAll()
        Returns:
        Boolean flag indicating whether to keep track of all classifier evaluations or just the average ones after all the runs. The default is true.

      • getDataIndexes

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getDataIndexes(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> currentIndexes,
                                                    java.lang.Object objectType)
        Gets the re-ordered indexes, the way that they will be set to the classifiers.
        Parameters:
        currentIndexes - ArrayList that are the current indexes.
        objectType - Object that is the data context.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of re-arranged indexes according to the order in which they will be set to the classifiers.

      • getIndexPermutation

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getIndexPermutation(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> currentIndexes,
                                                         java.lang.Object objectType)
        Unlike the getDataIndexes, this doesn't output the actual pointer indexes to places in the newly set DataSet it rather gives the permutation of the original index array, so it is the 'intermediate' information, used to re-sort some of the arrays in the original index ordering.
        Parameters:
        currentIndexes - ArrayList that are the current indexes to be set as the training data.
        objectType - Object that is the data context.
        Returns:
        ArrayList pointing to the locations of the original indexes, when viewed from within the set training data in the classifiers.
